data.title: The 2024 Social Media Image Sizes Guide
data.meta_description: The most up-to-date list of social image sizes and dimensions for Facebook, X (formerly Twitter), Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Snapchat, YouTube.
data.text:
You don’t need to be told how important your social media visuals are. In fact, a survey found that 63.2% of businesses rely heavily on images and videos as part of their marketing strategy.

There are so many platforms and so many rules.

Getting your visuals to look good on everything from Facebook to Pinterest is difficult without a guide. So we decided to make one.

We’ve looked at the various sizes and dimensions you need to know to make your social accounts look great and do what they’re supposed to.

All of the sizes in the titles are recommended ones. Often, you can use larger sizes but stick to the aspect ratios to ensure images and videos display correctly.

Below, you'll find dimensions for the following platforms:

Facebook

X (formerly Twitter)

Instagram

LinkedIn

YouTube

Pinterest

TikTok

Snapchat

Let's get to it.

Facebook profile picture size: 196 px x 196 px

Most likely, the most-viewed picture you’ll post on the platform – your Page’s profile picture – will act as your avatar across the site.

It’s often the first thing people will see when they come across you and will appear alongside your posts, your comments, and pretty much all of your Facebook activity.

Guidelines

The picture will display at 176 x 176 pixels on computers and 196 x 196 pixels on smartphones

For best quality, your uploaded photo should be at least 320 x 320 pixels

It needs a 1:1 aspect ratio

The picture will be cropped to a circle

Facebook cover image size: 851 px x 315 px

Introduced in 2011, Facebook cover photos give you a huge chunk of space at the top of your page to stick a photo or a video.

This is a great way to add more character to your page without sacrificing your pretty profile picture.

Guidelines

For best results, the picture must be at least 400 pixels wide and 150 pixels tall

The aspect ratio is 16:9

Remember that your profile picture partially covers the left-hand side of your cover photo

You can upload a single photo or multiple photos that will be displayed as a slideshow

Get all the details for cover images here

Facebook shared link image size: 1200 px x 630 px

This refers to the image Facebook uses when it generates a box from a shared link. You also get the content’s title and description along with the image.

Getting the image size right is integral to making your content look good whenever someone shares it on Facebook. Get it wrong, and the image can be cropped poorly or stretched out.

Guidelines

The link image is automatically pulled from the destination web page

Consider how the image will fit with your content’s title and description

The image must be smaller than 8 MB

If you have issues sharing an image link, you can fix it with the Sharing Debugger

Facebook post image size: 1080 px x 1350 px

That’s the best recommendation for making an image look good on your timeline and on your fans’ Newsfeeds.

Guidelines

Multiple placements are available for your image posts on and off your Timeline. You can check the detailed recommended sizes here

Facebook will auto-crop or resize when you exceed limits, so always test your image

Other Facebook image and video sizes:

Facebook group cover image size: 1640 px x 856 px

Facebook video source ratio: 16:9 to 9:16

Maximum Facebook video length on Feed: 240 minutes

Facebook image and video ad sizes

Facebook Story video ad size: at least 1080 x 1080 pixel

Facebook Messenger Stories image ad size: at least 1080 x 1080 pixel

Facebook Reels recommended ratio: 9:16 and recommended resolution of 1080 pixel

X profile picture size: 400 px x 400 px

Seen on your profile page and on every tweet you make, your X profile picture is very important. Particularly so if you’re a brand.

Most commonly, companies will use their logos, but some also make seasonal edits to spruce them up and grab a bit of attention now and then.

Guidelines

Remember that the profile picture will be circular

Recommended image size: 400 by 400 pixels

Minimum image size: 200 by 200 pixels

The aspect ratio is 1:1

Maximum file size: 2 MB

X in-stream photos image size: 1600 px x 900 px

As previously mentioned, sharing images increases engagement and gets more people to see your content. Getting the right image size will help you maximize results.

X will crop and resize based on the image you use. To get it looking at its best in the stream, though, 1600 px x 900 px is your best bet.

Guidelines

Minimum size: 600 by 335 pixels

Supported formats: GIF, JPG, and PNG

The maximum file size is 5 MB for images and GIFs on mobile and 15 MB on the web

X header photo size: 1500 px x 500 px

Like Facebook, X lets you add a huge photo to your profile to show how interesting and great you are.

Businesses use this in different ways, from advertising new products and events, extra branding, or just showing some nice staff photos.

Guidelines

Beware that the image will be responsive based on screen size, so choose with variation in mind

To future-proof the image, it’s best to use the maximum size

Header images are cropped to an aspect ratio of 3:1

Other X image and video sizes:

Minimum X card image size: 120 x 120 pixels

X video size: 720 x 720 pixels (square), 1280 x 720 pixels (landscape), 720 x 1280 pixels (portrait). You can read more on video specifications here

Maximum X video length: 140 seconds (Premium subscribers can post videos up to three hours long)

You can find an overview of X image and video sizes for ads here

Instagram profile picture size: 320 px x 320 px

As with all profile pictures, this will be seen next to every photo you post, so it’s important to make it eye-catching.

Your profile picture will display at 110 px x 110 px on mobile and 180 px x 180 px on desktop. A 320 px x 320 px image will ensure it looks good across all devices.

Guidelines

Keep the aspect ratio to 1:1

The profile picture will be cropped to a circle

Instagram photo sizes:

1080 px x 1080 px (square)

1080 px x 566 px (landscape)

1080 px x 1350 px (portrait)

This refers to the photo seen in the Instagram feed or when tapped on from elsewhere (such as someone’s profile page).

Guidelines

1080 px is your limit – anything over, and you’ll have to crop your image

Always remember how it looks on mobile is more important than on desktop

Instagram thumbnail image size: 161 px x 161 px (1:1)

This is how your picture will appear on someone’s profile page or in a hashtag search. Something that catches the eye can be important.

Getting this right is very handy if you’re showcasing products, while even more so if you want to turn your entire profile page into a single picture.

Guidelines

If your image is a 1:1 square, you can go straight away

For rectangle or vertical photos, Instagram will crop from the center

Instagram Stories and Reels size: 1080 px x 1920 px

Instagram Stories and Reels are the most popular content forms on Instagram, and uploading them in the correct size format is important to catch the eye of the viewer.

Guidelines

The ideal size for Instagram Stories and Reels is 1080 px x 1920 px

The aspect ratio is 9:16

The video might get cropped to fit the ratio if you don't stick to the ratio

The recommended size for the Reel cover photo is 420 px x 654 px

Other Instagram sizes

Recommended Instagram video aspect ratio: 1:1 ratio (square), 1.91:1 (horizontal), 4:5 (vertical)

Carousel posts and ads: 1080 px x 1080 px (square), 1080 px x 566 px (landscape), and 1080 px x 1350 px (portrait) are also supported and can be a video or static image

Instagram ads size: 1080 px x 566 px (landscape), 1080 px x 1080 px (square), 1080 px x 1920 px (Stories)

LinkedIn company logo image size: 400 px x 400 px

Your company logo image will lead your brand’s way on the platform. It’s generally just filled out with your logo.

This is probably the best approach for a platform like LinkedIn, but if you feel like trying something different, go ahead.

Guidelines

Images smaller than 400 px × 400 px work but risk being cropped and pixelated

The image will be cropped into a circle

The image must be a JPEG or PNG file and under 3 MB

LinkedIn Page’s cover image size: 1128 px x 191 px

Here, we have a massive space for an image on your LinkedIn Page. It goes right at the top, so it’s some prime real estate to show what you’re offering.

Guidelines

Remember, your company logo image will poke through from below

Also, keep in mind that if the image has a low resolution, it'll look blurry

Keep in mind that the image will appear differently on various devices

LinkedIn Life tab main image size: 1128 px x 376px

This hero image refers to the ‘Life' tab company pages have when they signed up for the platform’s paid recruitment service.

It’s used to show off a company’s culture in order to attract recruits, so if you’re getting one set up, it’s best to aim for fun and happiness rather than gray suits and briefcases.

Guidelines

This only applies if you have the Life tab on your company page

Other Life tab image sizes: Life tab custom modules image size: 502 x 282 pixels and Life tab company photos image sizes: 900 x 600 pixels

Other LinkedIn image and video sizes:

LinkedIn post image size: 1200 px x 627 px

LinkedIn link post size: 1200 px x 627 px

YouTube profile picture image size: 800 px x 800 px

The YouTube profile image isn’t as prominent compared to other platforms, but it’s still important.

What you choose is up to you. YouTubers often use a picture of their own face, while publishers and companies use their logos. Spend some time thinking about the best choice for you.

Guidelines

The recommended image size is 800 px x 800 px, any smaller than that, you risk a low-quality image

If you are uploading a photo, make sure it's centered

The profile picture will be cropped into a circle

Displays as 98 x 98 pixels

Image types: JPG, GIF, BMP, or PNG

YouTube channel cover image size: 2560 px x 1440 px

Also referred to as ‘channel art,’ this will sit at the top of your YouTube channel. It gets a lot of space, so it’s worth taking time over it.

Think about what will help explain what to expect from your channel. A good place to start is to look at the topics you most often discuss.

Guidelines

Minimum dimension: 2560 px x 1440 px

Aspect ratio is 16:9

Remember that your cover image will be displayed differently on devices and may be cropped, so make sure to have the most important information in the middle of the image

YouTube thumbnail image size: 1280 px x 720 px

When you upload a video, YouTube can pick a frame from it as the image preview. This isn’t always suitable, though, mainly if the video is in the wrong aspect ratio or you want a more descriptive cover.

When you want to have your own image, you can create it separately. Take a look at some of the most subscribed-to YouTubers to get some inspiration.

YouTube Shorts size: 1920 px x 1080 px

YouTube Shorts are a great way to post snackable content. There are some different rules compared to regular YouTube videos. For one, to be able to post YouTube Shorts, you must have at least 1,000 subscribers.

Guidelines

Dimensions are 1920 px x 1080 px with a 9:16 aspect ratio

Videos must be shot vertically

Videos can be up to 60 seconds long. It can be one video or several 15-second-long videos combined

Pinterest social image sizes

Pinterest is all about visuals. Over 480 million people use Pinterest monthly to discover trends and find inspiration about anything from weddings to decorating their homes, so it’s a prime spot for retail companies.

Getting the images right and showing off your products properly is essential.

Pinterest profile photo size: 165 px x 165 px

The Pinterest profile photo doesn’t take up too much space on Pinterest, but it’s nice to give a human face to your boards.

Guidelines

The image will be cropped into a circle

It must be kept below 10 MB

Pinterest cover image size: 800 px x 450 px

You can add a cover image to your profile to make it more captivating and make it stand out.

Guidelines

Image must be at least 800 px x 450 px wide

The recommended aspect ratio is 16:9

Pinterest Pin image size: 1000 px x 1500 px

Pins are all those images you see on Pinterest that other people have submitted. They act differently on different parts of the site, so the guidelines are a bit more in-depth for this one.

Guidelines

Pins sit in portrait mode, usually with an aspect ratio of 2:3

Pins with an aspect ratio greater than 2:3 might get cut off in people's feeds

File type: PNG or JPEG

Maximum file size: 20 MB

Pinterest board display image size: 600 px x 600 px

Once you’ve spent ages putting together some great pins in a board, you want the board to look good, too.

A board cover image can help users understand what’s on the board and entice them to click.

To set this, you’ll need to upload the image you want to use as a pin first.

Guidelines

The aspect ratio is 1:1

Your cover image will sit square with two other pins on the right

Using the board ‘Edit’ function, you can set the cover

Other Pinterest image sizes:

Pinterest Video specs: square (1:1) or vertical (2:3, 9:16); length: minimum 4 seconds, maximum 15 minutes

Pinterest carousels: image aspect ratio: 1:1 or 2:3, 1000 px x 1000 px, or 1000 px x 1500 px

Pinterest Story Pins image size: 1080 px x 1920 px

TikTok Profile photo: 200 px x 200 px

Your profile photo will be the first thing people see when they look at your videos. Brands usually use their logo for their profile photo.

Guidelines

The recommended image size is 200 px x 200 px, but it must be at least 20 px x 20 px

The aspect ratio is 1:1

The photo will be cropped to a circle

TikTok video size: 1080 px x 1920 px

TikTok is all about videos. To stick out and catch the attention of viewers, it’s important to get the dimensions right.

Guidelines

The aspect ratio is 19:6

The maximum video length for videos recorded in the app is three minutes; for uploaded videos, it's ten minutes

Recommended TikTok image sizes:

TikTok Stories size: 1080 px x 1920 px, maximum 15 seconds long

TikTok in-feed ad video aspect ratio: 9:16, 1:1, or 16:9
